title: In the series Game of Thrones, will Brienne of Tarth marry?
preds: Pod, they've spent time together, have similar views and he has the magic cock.

Full disclosure:  I do not watch this program, do not care about it, and have no idea who any of these people are, or would be if they were real.  I am working off what I can pick up from the popular press, and will be embarrassed if I do well on GoT questions.  Good luck to those of you who care, though.
its either no-one, or she decides to leave to find tormund, which is unlikely but still a small possibility
Her character is all about being a knight, marring some lord to be a lady is not important to her. Also only royal marriages/weddings were presented in the show.
Ending could have her move North with Tormund, or have her be married in some epilogue to some person or not at all
This feels like such an unnecessary plot thread compared with everything else they have to wrap up on Sunday.
But ... If Jon is to be king, there are no queens left.. except yara and brienne....
Focus seems like it will be on Kings Landing aftermath.  Feel like Winterfell characters are now done

Jaime left for his love of Cersei and will probably die, Tormund is gone back North, Sandor will probably die in his battle with Gregor.  I think there is a small chance they could throw something in, so believe high probability she won't marry

Aside from the fact that she has no interest in either, Tormund is heading north of the wall and I don't think the hound survives. I guess maybe Jamie if he survives and goes back to her but that feels unlikely.

Her femininity has been defined by her breaking new ground in a male dominated field, not through the traditional role of marriage. To make her marry now would break the existing character arc. (incongruent with character arc).

Understanding this is the TV show (and therefore the obvious is could happen, unlike GRRM), I give most of the chances to Jaime, but leaving the door open to a non-marriage relation. Both Tormund and the Hound will have a honourable death, emotionally televised. My wife's forecast as well.

Conditional on her marrying, Jaime seems overwhelmingly likely, given statements by the showrunners and statements by the actress. [1]  As to the likelihood of her marrying, I find this hard to say. There is the considerable chance of her dying. Even if she survives and completes her "feminine warrior" arc, marriage is not required for that. Jaime apparently has also foreshadowed his own death to be in the arms of the women that he loves. [2] From recent developments, that's unlikely to be Cersei. My informed gut judgment: 
- Survival of Brienne: 50%
- Marriage conditional on survival: 25%
- Marrying Jaime conditional on marriage: 90%
- Marrying Tormund conditional on marriage: 8%
- Marrying the Hound conditional on marriage: 1%
- Marrying someone else (probably Pod) conditional on marriage: 1% [1] https://metro.co.uk/2017/08/31/brienne-of-tarth-drops-a-huge-hint-about-a-game-of-thrones-romance-in-season-8-6893998/
[2] https://www.reddit.com/r/freefolk/comments/bj0ygc/brienne_and_jaime/
